name: Easy Yogurt Cake
author: Diana Moutsopoulos
summary: This is an easy yogurt cake that uses the yogurt container to measure all of the ingredients. It's ready in under an hour and the perfect not-too-sweet snack or breakfast treat. It's known in France as "Gâteau au Yaourt" and is typically the first cake that French children learn how to make. My son attends a French school and has made this with his classmates.
ingredients: 3 fluid ounces 1/2 yogurt container vegetable oil
7 ⅞ ounces 1 1/2 yogurt containers white sugar
5 ⅞ ounces 1 3/4 yogurt containers all-purpose flour
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease a 9-inch round springform cake pan
Empty the yogurt into a mixing bowl
Measure the oil, using the yogurt container, and add to the yogurt
Rinse yogurt container and dry with paper towel to continue using it as a measuring tool
Add eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract to the yogurt-oil mixture
Add flour, baking powder, and salt
Stir until just combined; batter will be thick
Pour into the prepared cake pan and spread to level the top
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes
